smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 18 diagram pages contain at least one element.

On page 2 (Use Case Diagram 'Parkimiskohtade funktsionaalne allsüsteem'), the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' (from Läbivad huvid) is only connected via «include» relationships to other use cases, but has ZERO direct actor associations. All other use cases have direct actor connections.

All use case names in page 2 describe distinct activities: Registreeri, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Lõpeta, Vaata aktiivseid, Vaata kõiki, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid, Unusta, Vaata koondaruannet, Tuvasta kasutaja. No two use cases have the same/similar activity name associated with the same actor.
On page 1 (Package diagram), all packages contain elements with unique names within each package. No duplicate element names found within any single package.

The database diagrams (pages 13-18) show tables with columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appearing in multiple status classifier tables (Isiku_seisundi_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Parkimiskoha_seisundi_liik), but these represent different data contexts (different types of status) and are structurally similar but not redundant copies of the same data value. Per the rule, identically named columns in unrelated tables are NOT redundancy.
All use cases on page 2 follow consistent verb-first naming pattern (Estonian verbs): Vaata, Lõpeta, Registreeri, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Unusta, Tuvasta. All start with active verbs.

Page 11 (State diagram 'Parkimiskoha seisundidiagramm') shows 6 states: Alg (initial), Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud. All states have incoming transitions: Alg is initial state with implicit entry; Ootel receives from Alg; Aktiivne receives from Ootel and Mitteaktiivne; Mitteaktiivne receives from Aktiivne; Lõpetatud receives from Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne; Unustatud receives from Ootel. Every state can be reached.

Activity diagrams on pages 3-4 show all actions can be reached from the start node (Algus). Page 3: Vaata → decision → Otsi/Vali → Lõpeta all reachable. Page 4: similar structure with all actions reachable from Algus through decision paths.

All class and database diagrams show multiplicity indicators on both ends of relationships. Example from page 6: Isik to Riik shows '1' and '0..*'; page 10 shows multiplicities like '1' and '0..*' on all associations; database diagrams (pages 13-18) show multiplicity like '1' and '0..*' or '0..1' on FK relationships.

Page 2 (Use Case Diagram 'Parkimiskohtade funktsionaalne allsüsteem') contains 11 use cases (central elements): 1-Tuvasta kasutaja, 2-Vaata Parkimiskohtade koondaruannet, 3-Lõpeta Parkimiskoht, 4-Registreeri Parkimiskoht, 5-Muuda Parkimiskoht, 6-Aktiveeri Parkimiskoht, 7-Muuda Parkimiskoht mittaktiivseks, 8-Vaata aktiivseid Parkimiskohti, 9-Vaata kõiki Parkimiskohti, 10-Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid Parkimiskohti, 11-Unusta Parkimiskoht. Threshold is ≥10. Since 11 ≥ 10, smell IS present. (Actors are NOT counted as central elements per the rules.)

Multiple diagrams have elements with ≥6 visual connection lines. Page 6 (Isikute register): Isik class has 6 visible connections: 1-to Riik, 2-to Isiku_seisundi_liik, 3-to Kasutajakonto, 4-to Klient, 5-to Töötaja, 6-self-relationship (mentor/juhendatav). Count=6, threshold ≥6, 6≥6, smell IS present. Page 10 (Parkimiskoha register): Parkimiskoht has 7 visible connections: to Parkimiskoha_seisundi_liik, Parkimiskoha_kategooria_omamine, Parkimiskoha_aadress, Parkimiskoha_suurus, Töötaja (registreerija), Töötaja (viimane muutja), plus the self-relation to the juhendatav/mentor. Count=7, threshold ≥6, smell IS present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows elements are reasonably distributed without any relationship distance exceeding twice the average distance between elements. Elements are clustered logically without extreme spacing disparities.

Page 4 (Activity diagram 'Kasutusjuhu Aktiveeri Parkimiskoht stsenaariumid') contains actions that do not start with active verbs: 'Parkimiskoha aktiveerimine õnnestub' (starts with noun 'Parkimiskoha') and 'Parkimiskoha aktiveerimine ebaõnnestub' (starts with noun 'Parkimiskoha'). These are noun phrases describing results rather than verb-first action names.

All class names, table names, attribute names, and use case names have ≥4 characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars), 'kood' (4 chars). All are ≥4 characters. Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since minimum found is 4, 4 > 3, smell is NOT present.
All class names start with uppercase letters and are singular: Isik, Klient, Töötaja, Parkimiskoht, Klassifikaator, Kasutajakonto, etc. No lowercase starting letters or plural forms found.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase letters: isikukood, e_meil, eesnimi, perenimi, reg_aeg, nimetus, on_aktiivne, parool, kood, etc. No uppercase starting letters found in attribute names.

All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Klient, Tootaja, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, Parkimiskoht, Parkimiskoha_kategooria_omamine, Isiku_seisundi_liik, etc. No plural table names found.

No type prefixes like tbl_, uc_, str, int found in class, table, or attribute names. The prefixes PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ are used (e.g., PK_Isik, FK_Isik_Riik, IXFK_Isik_Riik) but these are explicitly ALLOWED per the rule for primary keys, foreign keys, partial foreign keys, and indexes.
